text: Sushil's bush frog or Andiparai Shola Bush Frog (Raorchestes sushili) is a frog. It lives in India. Scientists have seen it in Valaparai in the Western Ghat mountains. People have seen this frog in evergreen forests between 1000 and 1600 meters above sea level. The frog sits on plants 1-3 m above the ground. People have not seen this frog in places that human beings have changed. Like other frogs in Raorchestes, this frog hatches out of its egg as a small frog. Scientists believe this frog is in danger of dying out because it lives in a small place. ==First paper== * ==References== Category:Frogs of Asia
title: Raorchestes sushili
